text: {| class="infobox football" style="width: 19em; text-align: center;" |- ! colspan=3 style="font-size: 16px;" |2015–16 in Polish football |- | colspan=3 style="font-size: 12px; background: #BFD7FF;" | Ekstraklasa champions |- | colspan=3 style="font-size: 12px;" | Legia Warsaw |- | colspan=3 style="font- size: 12px; background: #BFD7FF;" | Polish Cup winner |- | colspan=3 style="font-size: 12px;" | Legia Warsaw |- | colspan=3 style="font-size: 12px; background: #BFD7FF;" | Polish SuperCup winner |- | colspan=3 style="font- size: 12px;" | Lech Poznań |- | colspan=3 style="font-size: 12px; background: #BFD7FF;" | Teams in Europe |- | colspan=3 style="font-size: 12px;" | Lech Poznań, Legia Warsaw, Jagiellonia Białystok, Śląsk Wrocław |- | colspan=3 style="font-size: 12px; background: #BFD7FF;" | Poland national team |- | colspan=3 style="font-size: 12px;" | UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying |- | colspan=3 style="font-size: 12px;" | UEFA Euro 2016 |} The 2015–16 season was the 91st season of competitive football in Poland. ==League competitions== ===Ekstraklasa=== ====Regular season==== ====Championship round==== ====Relegation round==== ==Polish Cup== ==Polish SuperCup== ==Polish clubs in Europe== ===Lech Poznań=== ;2015–16 UEFA Champions League ;2015–16 UEFA Europa League ===Legia Warsaw=== ;2015–16 UEFA Europa League ===Jagiellonia Białystok=== ;2015–16 UEFA Europa League ===Śląsk Wrocław=== ;2015–16 UEFA Europa League ==National teams== ===Poland national team=== ==Notes and references==
title: 2015–16 in Polish football
